_header: Saint John the gospeller us tells
Note: For other MSS see 4636; for the text in the ‘expanded’ Cycle see 4649.
_description: Gospel for the Fourth Sunday in Lent in the Northern Homily Cycle

BodAsh42.First Lines:
SAynte Ione þe gospellere vs tellesþe gospell of to daie
                    and spelles…
BodAsh42.Last Lines:
…þat may ȝe be a tale hereþat i will now to
                    ȝow lere
BodAsh42.Editions:
Thompson,  Anne B.,
                        ed.  
             The Northern Homily
                    Cycle.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2008.

CULAdd8335.First Lines:
Seynt Ione þe euangelist vs tellesÞis day in one of his
                    godspelles…
CULAdd8335.Last Lines:
…Þat may ȝe by a tale hereþat I wille telle if
                    ȝe wille here
CULAdd8335.Attributed Title: Dominica in medio quadragesime secundum Iohannem (p. 141)

HunHM129.First Lines:
Seint Ion þe gospellere vs tellythþe gospell of to day
                    and spellyth…
HunHM129.Last Lines:
…Crist lokyd hym a boute and sawþat moche folk gan to hym
                    draw…
HunHM129.Note:
Fragment of fourteen lines only, with note in Latin at end, ‘Et
                        cetera omnia qui sequitur require in vltimo euangelio dominicalium quia ibi
                        debet io id quod hic erit (f. 86); Hanna records as if this appeared on
                    f. 89.
HunHM129.Editions:
Hanna,  Ralph,
                        ed.  
             “The Index of Middle English Verse and Huntington Library Collections: A
                Checklist of Addenda.” 
             Publications of the Bibliographical Society of America
         74 (1980): 235-58: 251.
